page.title: 15EARLY LANGAR
page.content: The{Domesday Book}records that Langar was 'possesed of half a church',which wasn't completed until 1200. The small village between the manor house and the River Smite. Before 1066 it was owned by Godrick the Saxon.St Andrews Church is the largest in Notts.We think the church was large because of all the visitors who came to St Ethelburgha's Priory near Langar.This has now disappeared. Some very important people have been buried at Langar especially the {Scroopes}and{Howes,}whose magnificent tombs are in the North and South transepts.At the West end is a splendid stained glass window.The church,partly restored in {Victorian times by{Thomas Butler},father of the famous{Samuel Butler},is well worth a visit.A flower Festival is held over the Whitsun Holiday.
